job_tasks.phrase: Partner with a geographically distributed organization spanning Networking SW, HW, Customers to define, design and optimize DPU Compiler SW at NVIDIA.
job_tasks.justification: The phrase describes core software engineering activities such as defining, designing, and optimizing software, which aligns with traditional software development tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: Invent and improve middle-end and back-end compiler optimizations in Clang/LLVM targeting NVIDIA DPU
job_tasks.justification: Developing and optimizing software components like compiler optimizations is a direct application of software development principles.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement complex back-end passes (register allocation, scheduling and others) for high performance custom processors that meet hard real time performance requirements
job_tasks.justification: Implementing specific software components, such as back-end compiler passes for processors, is a fundamental software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Drive new compiler features that improve programmability of NVIDIA DPUs and contribute to definition of DPU programming model.
job_tasks.justification: Driving new software features and contributing to the definition of programming models are core responsibilities within software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Participate in complete HW / SW co-design cycle from pre-silicon to launch to customer support.
job_tasks.justification: Engaging in a hardware/software co-design cycle involves integration and development across different domains, fitting within software development and integration.

soft_skills.phrase: Partner with a geographically distributed organization
soft_skills.justification: Partnering with a distributed organization necessitates strong communication and collaboration skills.

soft_skills.phrase: Participate in complete HW / SW co-design cycle
soft_skills.justification: Participation in a co-design cycle implies teamwork and collaboration with various stakeholders.
Being part of a team inherently requires collaboration and effective communication.

profile.rationale: The job description exclusively details tasks related to software development and integration (1.A.1), specifically focusing on compiler design and optimization. There are no tasks related to AI/ML model development, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, or data engineering for AI/ML. While the role operates within the domain of AI, HPC, and data centre technologies, its core responsibilities are traditional software engineering tasks. Therefore, it aligns with the Software Engineer profile, as the final product is a compiler, not an AI-powered system.

confidence.reasoning: The job description is highly specific and clearly outlines responsibilities focused entirely on compiler engineering, a well-defined area of software development. There is no ambiguity regarding AI/ML specific responsibilities, making the classification straightforward.
